column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: occupation. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```ttl@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix oc: <http://example.org/Occupation#> .oc:Occupation a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Occupation"@en ;    rdfs:comment "The principal activity that a person spends his time doing for the purpose of earning income"@en .oc:hasOccupation a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has occupation"@en ;    rdfs:domain oc:Person ;    rdfs:range oc:Occupation .oc:Person a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Person"@en .oc:Engineer a oc:Occupation ;    rdfs:label "Engineer"@en .oc:Doctor a oc:Occupation ;    rdfs:label "Doctor"@en .oc:Teacher a oc:Occupation ;    rdfs:label "Teacher"@en .oc:Alice a oc:Person ;    oc:hasOccupation oc:Engineer .oc:Bob a oc:Person ;    oc:hasOccupation oc:Doctor .oc:Charlie a oc:Person ;    oc:hasOccupation oc:Teacher .```This small ontology defines a class for occupations and persons. And has a property for connection person with their occupation. Then it creates instances for three different occupations: Engineer, Doctor, and Teacher. And three persons (Alice, Bob, Charlie), each with a different occupation.
